text: we lost a girl because of circumcision
so I saw that in this community I saw
girls as young as seven as young as
eight when their dreams are taken away
after circumcision they are married off
at the age of 10 12 and I knew that when
I agreed to undergo the cut I will not
be able to come to school I started
helping girls escape but I thought this
was not enough because they go back to
their family they start fights they run
away then where do I check them so you
know we kept on fighting with the
community and that is when I realized we
need to find a way of talking to them
[Music]
it's not easy because a woman is not
supposed to talk in front of men in this
community but I knew fighting female
genital mutilation
it takes time I wanted to use education
as a way of convincing them but we
really need to invest in girls education
the same way we're investing in boys
education

so we said in the whole process of
female genital mutilation what example
is just a cut so let us call it a cut
and all the other rituals that are
performed during circumcision time let
us remain with it because morally we
need to feel like we are still learning
our culture that is good and that way
for the last seven years we've been able
to reach over fifteen thousand girls who
are now women without their cut and they
in school I think with books and pens
when we invest in girls education they
will be able to become professors
doctors and teachers journalists or
anything they want to become and that is
my hope that all of them will be able to
get education
